snippet: Facing a persistent backlog of disability claims, and criticism, the Obama administration says its next budget will include significant increases for veterans programs.
abstract: Obama administration, facing growing criticism from Congress over persistent backlog in processing claims for wounded veterans, announces that it will include significant increases for veterans’ programs, including money for mental health services, in latest budget.
lead_paragraph: Facing a persistent backlog of disability claims, and criticism, the Obama administration says its next budget will include significant increases for veterans programs.

headline.seo: Administration Seeks to Increase Spending on Veterans Programs
headline.main: Veterans’ Programs Are Set for Raise in Spending Plan
headline.print_headline: Veterans’ Programs Are Set For Raise in Spending Plan

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
